entries.meaning: (biology) The practice of being terrestrial, typically of amphibians in a dry climate
The quality of belonging to the earth.
examples: It is the Terrestrialism of the African (Yoruba) world-view that established its identity and distinguishes it from western rationalism. Terrestrialism locates man in a cosmic totality, presenting a unified sensibility, where his earth-boundedness is indispensable from the entire cosmic phenomenon.
